list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Could you undo the knot in this string?

list_definition.definition: to reverse, or destroy, the effect of

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The evil that he did can never be undone.

list_ex_of_english: Once this land is built upon, the development cannot be undone.
In fact, what is to be done under the scheme cannot be undone at a stroke and is bound to go for some years.
The prediction here is that success at undoing the gliding error pattern should result automatically in the loss of the harmony error pattern without direct treatment on the latter.
We should leave nothing undone to see that the quality is preserved.
Many of these people live in fear of their past coming to the surface, and of much that they have done being undone.
All the good work of the last few years will have been undone and it will all have been to no avail.
There are many things that are very desirable, and very productive, too, but which must be left undone for the time being.
In many cases, then, what they say they want to do in the daytime is undone overnight.
